docs.snippet: Latin-American export credit collections made by fifteen large New York City banks improved during November, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. Aggregate dollar volume of outstanding draft indebtedness reported by these banks,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin-American export credit collections made by fifteen large New York City banks improved during November, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. Aggregate dollar volume of outstanding draft indebtedness reported by these banks, which participate in the Federal Reserve's monthly survey, declined $4,000,000 to $177,400,000. This was the lowest level since May.

headline.main: COLLECTIONS GAIN ON LATIN EXPORTS; Dollar Debt Dips $4,000,000 in November to Lowest Level Since May

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 17 -- The Government campaign to harass the independent newspapers Nacion and Prensa has entered a new phase. The municipality of Buenos Aires is invoking all the technicalities on the books to hamper, without halting, day-to-day...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 17 -- The Government campaign to harass the independent newspapers Nacion and Prensa has entered a new phase. The municipality of Buenos Aires is invoking all the technicalities on the books to hamper, without halting, day-to-day operation of the plants of both dailies.
docs.abstract: Govt invokes old zoning law to hamper pub of independent dailies

headline.main: NEW CURBS HARRY ARGENTINE DAILIES; Independent Prensa, Nacion Bedeviled by Invoking of Old Building Code Laws

docs.snippet: AFTER having been included for many years in the Scott Standard Postage Stamp Catalogue as a separate political entity, the region once philatelically known as "South Bulgaria" has been subordinated by the catalogue's publishers.
docs.lead_paragraph: AFTER having been included for many years in the Scott Standard Postage Stamp Catalogue as a separate political entity, the region once philatelically known as "South Bulgaria" has been subordinated by the catalogue's publishers.

headline.main: NEWS OF THE WORLD OF STAMPS; Changes in Listing Appear In the 1950 Edition of The Scott Catalogue

docs.snippet: Pressure on the Canadian dollar lifted last week when oil companies re-entered the market and United States postal authorities bought their monthly quota resulting in a climb from 87.38 cents, on Monday, which incidentally is a new low since...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pressure on the Canadian dollar lifted last week when oil companies re-entered the market and United States postal authorities bought their monthly quota resulting in a climb from 87.38 cents, on Monday, which incidentally is a new low since devaluation, to 88.62 cents, on Friday. The close was 88 cents, a gain of 5/16 cent over the previous week:

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Dec. 16, 1949

docs.snippet: The announcement that George F. Kennan, State Department Counselor, and Assistant Secretary of State Edward G. Miller Jr., who is in charge of Latin-American affairs, are going to make extended trips to our southern neighbors and will also be meeting...
docs.lead_paragraph: The announcement that George F. Kennan, State Department Counselor, and Assistant Secretary of State Edward G. Miller Jr., who is in charge of Latin-American affairs, are going to make extended trips to our southern neighbors and will also be meeting United States Ambassadors in two regional conferences is a reminder of obligations and interest that are sometimes forgotten.

docs.snippet: Last week's foreign exchange market was a quiet affair, the scant turnover and steady array of rates being an aftermath of the holiday spirit which ruled from the opening to the close.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week's foreign exchange market was a quiet affair, the scant turnover and steady array of rates being an aftermath of the holiday spirit which ruled from the opening to the close.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Dec. 23, 1949

docs.snippet: The purchase of the new Panamanian-flag vessel George by the Zim Israel Navigation Company was announced here yesterday by the American-Israeli Shipping Company, New York, agents for Zim.
